Topic.Title: Unable to create a new Quest game?

Posts.EditableText:
Self explanatory - I'm trying to create a new Quest game, through the "Create" tab, but the page it links to (https://textadventures.co.uk/create/new) doesn't actually provide any links to create the game. It lists the two types of Quest games (Those being text adventures and gamebooks), but nothing else besides that.

Opening the Squiffy editor works fine, but that isn't the engine I want to create games with.
Posts.HTML:
Self explanatory - I'm trying to create a new Quest game, through the "Create" tab, but the page it links to (https://textadventures.co.uk/create/new) doesn't actually provide any links to create the game. It lists the two types of Quest games (Those being text adventures and gamebooks), but nothing else besides that.

Opening the Squiffy editor works fine, but that isn't the engine I want to create games with.

Posts.EditableText:
https://textadventures.co.uk/create/new (click on this: goto its page, and on that page: see below)

select whether you want to create a 'Text Adventure' or 'Game Book' game (click on the drop down bown to select one of them)

type in the name of your game in the 'game name' text box

then, click on the 'create' button at the bottom (it is a bit hard to see / cameflaged, due to having the 'light blue' color against the white background)

--------

if these things aren't displaying for you... then there indeed is an issue preventing you from creating a game online.
(try using a different browser)
Posts.HTML:
https://textadventures.co.uk/create/new (click on this: goto its page, and on that page: see below)

select whether you want to create a 'Text Adventure' or 'Game Book' game (click on the drop down bown to select one of them)

type in the name of your game in the 'game name' text box

then, click on the 'create' button at the bottom (it is a bit hard to see / cameflaged, due to having the 'light blue' color against the white background)

if these things aren't displaying for you... then there indeed is an issue preventing you from creating a game online.
(try using a different browser)

Posts.EditableText: Thankfully, right after I posted this, the page actually decided to load the functionality required to actually create the game, including the 'game name' and 'game type' boxes. It seems like either Firefox or my internet forgets to load parts of this website's pages sometimes.
Posts.HTML: Thankfully, right after I posted this, the page actually decided to load the functionality required to actually create the game, including the 'game name' and 'game type' boxes. It seems like either Firefox or my internet forgets to load parts of this website's pages sometimes.

Posts.EditableText:
the servers are still getting the kinks out of them, as we transisted to a new to not to long ago, and Manowar is trying to get the servers up to speed (they are still "here and there" being shut down for a bit, for him to work on them for whatever they need).

so, maybe it wasn't any error... maybe the servers were jsut down during that time...

-------

the various browsers (IE, firefox, chrome, opera, safari, etc) are a bit different from each other, so different features of webpages and/or the coding that some websites use, might not be compatible with some browsers (depending on their own coding capabilities): aka, they (browsers and websites) can be INcompatible... so, just try a different browser (or if your browser is old: you've not updated it for awhile, then update your browser to the current version of it!)
Posts.HTML:
the servers are still getting the kinks out of them, as we transisted to a new to not to long ago, and Manowar is trying to get the servers up to speed (they are still "here and there" being shut down for a bit, for him to work on them for whatever they need).

so, maybe it wasn't any error... maybe the servers were jsut down during that time...

the various browsers (IE, firefox, chrome, opera, safari, etc) are a bit different from each other, so different features of webpages and/or the coding that some websites use, might not be compatible with some browsers (depending on their own coding capabilities): aka, they (browsers and websites) can be INcompatible... so, just try a different browser (or if your browser is old: you've not updated it for awhile, then update your browser to the current version of it!)
